abstract.text: An individual element displayed in the system menu bar.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: creates instances of this class and automatically adds them to the menu bar. Use the
property to customize the appearance and behavior of the status item.

abstract.text: Construct and manage a graphical, event-driven user interface for your macOS app.
An object that manages a collection of status items displayed within the system-wide menu bar.
Returns a newly created status item that has been allotted a specified space within the status bar.
The appearance and behavior of an item in the systemwide menu bar.
An individual element displayed in the system menu bar.
A set of optional status item behaviors.
The selector that is sent to the status itemâ€™s target when the status item is clicked.
The alternate image to be displayed when a status bar item is highlighted.
The attributed string that is displayed at the status itemâ€™s position in the status bar.
A unique name for saving and restoring information about a status item.
The set of allowed behaviors for the status item.
The button displayed in the status bar.
The selector that is sent to the status itemâ€™s target when the status item is double-clicked.
Draws the menu background pattern for a custom status-bar item in regular or highlight pattern.
A Boolean that indicates whether the status item is highlighted when it is clicked.
The image that is displayed at the status itemâ€™s position in the status bar.
A Boolean that indicates whether the status item is enabled to respond to clicks.
A Boolean value indicating if the menu bar currently displays the status item.
The amount of space in the status bar that should be allocated to the status item.
The pull-down menu displayed when the user clicks the status item.
Displays a menu under a custom status bar item.
Sets the conditions on which the status item sends action messages to its target.
A status item length that is equal to the status barâ€™s thickness.
The status bar that displays the status item.
The target object to which the status itemâ€™s action message is sent when the status item is clicked.
The string that is displayed at the status itemâ€™s position in the status bar.
The tool tip string that is displayed when the cursor pauses over the status item.
A status item length that dynamically adjusts to the width of its contents.
The custom view that is displayed at the status itemâ€™s position in the status bar.
The root class of most Objective-C class hierarchies, from which subclasses inherit a basic interface to the runtime system and the ability to behave as Objective-C objects.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
